t: Psalm 118
Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ld love endures forever.
Let*pn Israel say: “His*ld love endures forever.”
Let*ln the house of Aaron say: “His*ld love endures forever.”
Let*ln those who fear the Lord*s say: “His*ld love endures forever.”
When*pn hard pressed, I cried to the Lord;*s he*ld brought me into a spacious place.
The*ln Lord*s is with me; I will not be afraid. What*ld can mere mortals do to me?
The*ln Lord*s is with me; he is my helper. I*ld look in triumph on my enemies.
It*pn is better to take refuge in the Lord*s than*ld to trust in humans.
It*ln is better to take refuge in the Lord*s than*ld to trust in princes.
All*ln the nations surrounded me, but*ld in the name of the Lord*s I cut them down.
They*ln surrounded me on every side, but*ld in the name of the Lord*s I cut them down.
They*ln swarmed around me like bees, but*ld they were consumed as quickly as burning thorns; in*ld the name of the Lord*s I cut them down.
I*ln was pushed back and about to fall, but*ld the Lord*s helped me.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and my defense; he*ld has become my salvation.
Shouts*pn of joy and victory resound*ld in the tents of the righteous: “The*ln Lord’s*s right hand has done mighty things!
The*ld Lord’s*s right hand is lifted high; the*ld Lord’s*s right hand has done mighty things!”
I*ln will not die but live, and*ld will proclaim what the Lord*s has done.
The*ln Lord*s has chastened me severely, but*ld he has not given me over to death.
Open*ln for me the gates of the righteous; I*ld will enter and give thanks to the Lord.*s
This*ln is the gate of the Lord*s through*ld which the righteous may enter.
I*ln will give you thanks, for you answered me; you*ld have become my salvation.
The*pn stone the builders rejected has*ld become the cornerstone;
the*ln Lord*s has done this, and*ld it is marvelous in our eyes.
The*ln Lord*s has done it this very day; let*ld us rejoice today and be glad.
Lord,*spn save us! Lord,*sld grant us success!
Blessed*pn is he who comes in the name of the Lord.*s From*ld the house of the Lord*s we bless you.
The*ln Lord*s is God, and*ld he has made his light shine on us. With*ln boughs in hand, join in the festal procession up*ld to the horns of the altar.
You*pn are my God, and I will praise you; you*ld are my God, and I will exalt you.
Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ld love endures forever.
